fields.description:
Using a web item that has no URL set causes the web item to inherit the previously rendered web item's URL.

Offending code:

{code}
#macro (renderItemLink $item $isCurrent)
    #set ($itemRenderedUrl = $item.link.getDisplayableUrl($req, $action.webInterfaceContext))
[...]
    <a #if ($item.link.id) id="$item.link.id"#end href="$itemRenderedUrl" #if ($itemClass) class="$itemClass"#end #if ($item.link.hasAccessKey()) accessKey="$item.link.getAccessKey($helper)"#end #if ($itemTooltip) title="$itemTooltip"#end>
{code}

If no URL is set on the web item, getDisplayableUrl returns null, but Velocity doesn't set $itemRenderedUrl as null. Furthermore, $itemRenderedUrl hangs around in the Velocity context -- which has the effect that the previous web item's URL is outputted.

This would also be an issue for all the other variables.

Furthermore, we should wrap the href attribute on the <a> with an if statement, to allow web items to omit the URL.
fields.summary: #renderItemLink has Velocity scoping issues

fields.description:
If Confluence source code is customized and extra css is added to the war, Confluence returns text/html mimetype for all these css files. This causes layout to break because Firefox and other browsers ignore all css that don't have the correct mime type.

Fix is pretty simple and requires only one line of code that modifies the CssServlet. The patch is attached.
fields.summary: PATCH: Confluence sets incorrect content type for css files bundled in war

fields.description:
Quick Nav tooltips were changed in [CONF-13471] to show the space name, to help distinguish between pages with the same titles.

This means that now the tooltip shows both the space name and the page title. I think this is confusing - too much information being presented, and not obvious what the information is. It would be improved by showing only the space name on the tooltip.

Alternatively, if the full page title does need to be shown due to truncation issues, then the space name should be distinguished in some way - different colour, different font, bolded, etc.
fields.summary: Quick Nav result tooltips should only show the space name

fields.description:
I apologize if this is already filed or working as expected, as I couldn't seem to find out  via a quick search. :)

Removing a Space doesn't appear to removall all data related to the Space, I specifically noticed when altering Page Layout via Look and Feel.

Steps:

Create a space, one that doesn't reuse a previous space's key.
Create a custom Page Layout via Space Admin->Look and Feel->Layout->Page Layout->Create Custom.
Alter it a bit, I added some static content to the wiki-content div.
Save your changes, verifiy they are there when you view the default homepage.
Delete  the space.
Create a new space, using the same space key as earlier.
View the default home page.


What happened: The changes made prior to removing the space were still there.
Expected: Removal of the space should have removed even custom page layout.
Work around: Reset the layout to default after creation of the Space.

Notes: I was using the default theme.  I know this isn't usual usage, but while doing tons of testing on migration from FlexWiki/Sharepoint to Confluence, I often find it easier to just nuke the whole space, versus removing 100s of individual pages and stuff.
fields.summary: Removing a Space doesn't seem todo a 100% cleanup.

fields.description:
The recently-updated macro always gives attachments the generic "file" icon rather than specific ones for its type.

The sequence of events is:
# Macro calls the Velocity Renderer with its macro-pagelist.vm
# macro-pagelist.vm calls through to the pagelist.vm and retrieves a List of SearchResultWithExcerpt objects added by the macro
# pagelist.vm calls the contentIcon2 macro in macros.vm to generate an icon for each SearchResult
# for attachments, contentIcon2 parses the attachment_icon.vm, having set the SearchResultWithExcerpt as $attachment.
# attachment_icon.vm is expecting an actual Attachment object, so it fails to retrieve any of the parameters it expects to retrieve.

In general, the pagelist.vm seems happy to be passed SearchResultWithExcerpts, so it is hard to know what is doing the wrong thing.
Possible culprits:
* Maybe SearchResultWithExcerpt should imitate Attachments the same way it imitates everything else
* Maybe the Macro shouldn't be trying to use the pagelist.vm at all
* Maybe the attachment_icon should be handling SearchResultWithExcerpt objects specially
* Maybe contentIcon2 should be handling SearchResultWithExcerpt objects specially.

None of these objects are well documented so it is difficult to establish what inputs they are meant to accept.
fields.summary: recently-updated macro does not create correct icons for attachments

Your Confluence administrator can use the support request form to create a support ticket which will include this information.

We will respond as promptly as possible.

The current splash screen page looks like this:

      Choose Installation Type
      There are two ways to install Confluence. If you are in any doubt as to which you should choose, you should select the standard installation.

      Standard Installation
      Install Confluence with default settings and an embedded database. This is strongly recommended for anyone evaluating or demonstrating Confluence, as it will get you up and running as quickly as possible.

      Custom Installation
      Perform a custom setup. Select this option if you want to configure Confluence with an external database, or initialise the server with your own data.

This all needs reworking. I suggest:

      Choose Installation Type
      There are two ways to install Confluence. If you wish to have an easy setup for evaluation pick the Evaluation Installation for the in-memory built in database. If you are preparing for a production installation with reliable data storage, choose the External Database configuration.

      Evaluation Database
      Install Confluence with default settings and an embedded database. This is recommended for anyone evaluating or demonstrating Confluence, as it will get you up and running as quickly as possible.

      External Database Installation
      Select this option if you want to configure Confluence with an external database, or initialise the server with your own data.

fields.description:
While preparing our demo for AtlasCamp, Don and I found out that uploading a new OSGi (plugins 2) plugin which exports a component does not replace the component that other plugins are using.

This seems to be true even if you uninstall and reinstall the plugin, rather than replacing it.

This is not a blocker for 2.10, but it is a bit annoying. Replacing component implementations at runtime is one of the big selling points of the new framework.
fields.summary: OSGi components used by other plugins are not refreshed

fields.description:
When you move a space with children from SPACEA to SPACEB, it correctly moves all the children to SPACEB.

When you do a search (across all spaces) that should return one of the moved child pages, it correctly lists the child page as being in the new target space SPACEB.

However, if you limit the search location to SPACEB, nothing is found (incorrect: the page is now under SPACEB, and _should_ be found). If you limit the search to the original space SPACEA, the page is found (again incorrect: the page is now under SPACEB, and should _not_ be returned in a search limited to SPACEA). In the search results for the latter, it does recognize that the result is in SPACEB, next to the page title among the excerpts.

The behaviour appears to only affect child pages; the parent page appears when your search is limited to SPACEB.

It seems that the search index is not being rebuilt for children which are moved when a parent is moved. The problem goes away on a per-page basis when one of the child pages is edited (I presume this triggers re-indexing of that page).

Our admin was able to workaround the problem by rebuilding the search index.
fields.summary: Child pages that are moved to another space don't appear in a search limited to the target space.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Add a new user with umlauts in the name (e.g. Klaüs)
# Login as the user, add/modify a content
# As an admin, flush the caches and rebuild the index (just for precautions)
# Go to Confluence search
# In the Who field, search for "Kla" will suggest "Klaüs", but adding another character "ü" will not yield anything. In other words, search for "Klaüs" will return nothing in the suggestion tooltip.

For the record, Confluence passed the encoding test.
fields.summary: Umlauts in the Who suggestion tooltip in search do not work

  {panel}

The encoding test page (http://localhost:8080/admin/encodingtestrun.action) doesn't provide instructions to test for Asian languages such as Japanese, Chinese.  If they followed the provided instructions, they may assume their database supports Internationalization because the sample text we instruct users to paste will appear correct, but Japanese will not.

For example, if they paste Japanese into the box instead, it will fail with upside-down question marks.  This was produced under these conditions:
* Confluence 2.9.2
* Oracle Express Edition 10g (Western European) with encoding WE8MSWIN1252.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13636].
  {panel}


There are several reason it would be nice to be able to add a comment only to a version.

A save was made but a comment was forgotten.  It would be nice to just add one.

It would be a good way for document approval.  A person could go to the comments and mark their approval.  This is tracked in the history and would be useful to our use of Confluence.

Since everyone see the comment left it could be useful to be able to mark the status.  Havent edited a page for 2 day.  Big issue comes up and now I dont have time to work on this document a "On Hold" comment could be used to communicate a status.  If this was put in the comments below for the pages discussion, this message would be outdated and no longer useful once editing is resumed.
fields.summary: When editing a document it would be a good feature to let a comment count as an edit.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13634].
  {panel}

Please consider this as a feature request for a future release of Confluence.

Boolean operands on Space permissions would be awesome.  E.g. setup a Space that people in the LDAP group STAFF and the LDAP group Biosciences were the only people that were able to view/edit/add/etc - otherwise I have to have a group for "Staff in Biosiences", "Staff in Engineering", "Staff in Computing", etc.

Another use would be to add exclusions to Space permission, e.g. I want everyone in the Biosciences group to have full permissions on a Space, but *NOT* the users in the "Students in Biosciences" group as they should just be able to view.

One of the major gripes (in general, not specifically Confluence) is that they *HATE* having to set up permissions in different applications for the same groups of users.  We've gone some way in improving things by moving all of our Confluence group management to LDAP, but I think this functionality would make things even better.

Although we've moved all of our group management to LDAP I can see this being useful for people who are using confluence-groups and those that are using a mixture of confluence-groups and LDAP.

Boolean operands on group/user membership is phenomenally powerful and would put you miles ahead of anything else I've seen in terms of application permissions (and I'm not just talking wikis!!!).
fields.summary: Boolean operators on user and group management

based on David Yu's suggestion:
"Hello Raduz, It doesn't look like we can support CRAM-MD5 out of the box after speaking with a dev. I also thought that perhaps you'd be able to articulate your requirements better if the feature request was submitted by you."

I would like to suggest an implementation of CRAM-MD5 authentication method for the Confluence Mail Archiving feature

as per Davis's finding:
"I did some more testing here and found out a few things. It doesn't appear to be using atlassian-mail for this part of the code. According to my stack traces, it's using com.atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager.

javax.mail.AuthenticationFailedException: Auth method not enabled
	at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPStore.protocolConnect(IMAPStore.java:456)
	at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:236)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager.getStore(DefaultMailAccountManager.java:256)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager.retrieveMessages(DefaultMailAccountManager.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager.poll(DefaultMailAccountManager.java:89)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager.poll(DefaultMailAccountManager.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.mail.DefaultMailAccountManager.pollAllSpaces(DefaultMailAccountManager.java:242)

	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
I don't see any properties file for us to set to enable CRAM-MD5 (assuming this even works). The only way I can see is modifying the source code itself to support CRAM-MD5."

thank you
Raduz

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

Pages appearing in the ContentPermission cache but does not exists in the database when the pages are refreshed, mostly due to internal caches that's out of sync with the database. The following error will be thrown in the logs when this happens:
{noformat}
atlassian.confluence.core.CachingInheritedContentPermissionManager] rehydrate Unable to retrieve cached content property ID from database xxx
{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Not able to reliably reproduce this error message so far. 
h3. Impact of this error message

No impact and can be ignored. This is because Confluence will fall back and pull the information needed from the database rather than the cache.
h3. Suggested Solution

The error message should be logged as "Warning" instead.
 Add the information that Confluence is fetching the needed information from the database instead.
fields.summary: Improve "CachingInheritedContentPermissionManager" logging

fields.description:
*What and why:* At our Confluence site we use WEBSEC_CONFLUENCE_USERS as the general group for users, since this is a requirement of our User Directory (LDAP). If a user logs in and creates his personal space, the other users still don't have access, even if he checks the "[x] registered users" question at personal space creation time.

At personal space creation the question appears...
{code}Choose who can view and comment on content:
[x] Me
[x] Registered users - anyone logged into Confluence
{code}
But who is "registered users"? It's the standard group "confluence-users" that is entered into his space permissions to read and/or write.

*So the improvement would be:* The Confluence Admin should be allowed to set which group is meant by "registered users".
fields.summary: Let Confluence Admin globally chose what user group is meant by "registered users" when a user creates his personal space.

fields.description:
Should there be multiple documents with the same name presented by a QuickNav search, there is no immediate mechanism to let the user differentiate between these documents (e.g. find out what space they belong to),

CONF-13471 means that should the user be using the mouse and willing to inspect each item individually then they will be able to see in a tooltip the space name for each document. However this mechanism is so slow and unusable that it makes a mockery of the 'Quick' part of the feature name.

Two screenshots are attached. One shows the problem of duplicate documents and the other shows one possible solution where all the duplicates are rolled into one entry with a slide out submenu that will show the spaces each one belongs to.
fields.summary: In QuickNav visually differentiate between documents with the same name in different spaces

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Create a page "Parent page", with a child page "Child page"
* Add page restrictions to "Parent page"
* Delete "Parent page"

Expected behaviour:

* "Child page" is still restricted, but with a _copy_ of the page restrictions from "Parent page".

Actual behaviour:

* "Child page" is restricted by virtue of inherited permissions from "Parent page" in the trash
* When "Parent page" is purged from the trash, "Child page" is unrestricted.

Workaround:

* Move "Child page" to a different parent, then apply restrictions manually to "Child page".
fields.summary: Deleting a restricted page doesn't correctly apply restrictions to child pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13601].
  {panel}

When a user tries to edit a page with an existing draft, any further changes will be applied to that draft not a separate draft. This means that a user will overwrite any changes saved in the existing draft with their new changes.

Confluence should either:
* Allow multiple drafts to be saved for the one user on any one page.
* Not allow the user to edit an page unless they have decided to resume editing or discard a draft.
* Notify the user that any new changes will overwrite the existing draft.
fields.summary: Drafts can be overwritten without notifying the user

fields.description:
Please see if there are any obvious optimisations that will help reduce the number of seconds that Confluence Standalone/Tomcat takes to start serving users. It currently takes between 60 and 80 seconds for an average desktop PC to start an 'almost empty' instance of Confluence 2.9.1. While restarts should be very infrequent once deployed, the initial delay could potentially frustrate a new evaluator, or system administrator. 

Online discussion at http://www.nabble.com/OpenEJB-Tomcat-Deployments-td20000994.html mentions that starting a very basic application can take up to 25 seconds and the same application running frameworks such as Hibernate/Struts can take up to 55 seconds, but it may still be worth a look to see if we can do better.
fields.summary: Reduce the time taken for a new Confluence instance to start
Text inside the HTML macro should be indexed as plaintext rather than raw HTML

fields.description:
I was doing some testing about a report from a user that tried to remove a user to satisfy their user limit.  After removing the one user, they were not able to add a new user still.

I was able to reproduce this by generated a 5-user license.  If I removed the 5th user, and click License Details, it still reports my original count of users.  

If I attempt to add a new user, it will display an error:

The following error(s) occurred:
* The license for this Confluence installation is either missing, or invalid.  Please contact confluence-support@atlassian.com for assistance."

The above message will generate support issues.  Only until the user clicks *Refresh* under License Details does the user count correct itself.  The refresh button was done under [CONF-5208|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-5208].  We shouldn't display that error above.  We should advise the user to click refresh and link to the License Details page.

This was tested using internal user management and not OsUser, or LDAP.
fields.summary: Users should not have to click Refresh to update their license count after removing a user

fields.description: The Confluence 500 error page lists logging events generated during the request the produced the 500 error page. The strings rendered from this event are not HTML encoded, leaving open a chance for an attacker to exploit this via XSS. I haven't yet investigated to see whether this is actually possible or not, but we should just encode the strings to be sure.

fields.description:
To reproduce the problem:

1-) Go to a Space Page
2-) Click *Edit*
3-) Select the *Rich Text Editor* tab
4-) Click on the *Add Emoticon* menu icon
5-) Choose the *Smile Face*
6-) An SSL error will be displayed with the message: "You are trying to access a non secure content. Do you want to display the non secure content?"

After talking to DOS, was concluded that it is related to a known IE6 problem related to {{iFrames}}.

Workaround being proposed: Change IE6 settings, disabling the *Warn if changing between secure and not secure mode* option.
fields.summary: Adding a emoticon in rich text mode using Internet Explorer 6 and SSL prompts a security alert msg

fields.description:
(taken from [CONF-11794])

The RTE keyboard shortcuts for Bold/Italics/Underline have now been translated into French and German.

Unfortunately this means that incorrect information is given.

French has shortcut (Ctrl+G) for bold
German has shortcuts (Strg + Umschalt + F) for bold, (Strg + Umschalt + K) for italics, (Strg + Umschalt + U) for underline

None of these work in the RTE at present, only the usual English shortcuts will work.

Either:

   1. The information given in the translated tooltips should be changed, to give the working keyboard shortcut info
   2. The RTE should use different keyboard shortcuts depending on the language which is set
fields.summary: Incorrect keyboard shortcuts are given in French and German in RTE
